title: Hydrodynamic nucleation of quantized vortex pairs in a polariton quantum fluid
title_cn: 极化子量子流体中量化涡旋对的流体动力学成核
abstract: Quantized vortices appear in quantum gases at the breakdown of superfluidity. In liquid helium and cold atomic gases, they have been indentified as the quantum counterpart of turbulence in classical fluids. In the solid state, composite light–matter bosons known as exciton polaritons have enabled studies of non-equilibrium quantum gases and superfluidity. However, there has been no experimental evidence of hydrodynamic nucleation of polariton vortices so far. Here we report the experimental study of a polariton fluid flowing past an obstacle and the observation of nucleation of quantized vortex pairs in the wake of the obstacle. We image the nucleation mechanism and track the motion of the vortices along the flow. The nucleation conditions are established in terms of local fluid density and velocity measured on the obstacle perimeter. The experimental results are successfully reproduced by numerical simulations based on the resolution of the Gross–Pitaevskii equation.
abstract_cn: 在超流动性破裂时，量子气体中出现了涡旋。在液态氦和冷原子气体中，它们已被确定为经典流体中湍流的量子对应物。在固态下，被称为激子极化子的复合光子玻色子已使人们能够研究非平衡量子气体和超流动性。但是，到目前为止，还没有实验证明极化子旋涡的流体动力学成核。在这里，我们报告了通过障碍物的极化子流体的实验研究，以及在障碍物唤醒后量化涡流对成核的观察。我们对成核机制进行成像，并跟踪涡流沿流的运动。根据局部流体密度和在障碍物周长上测得的速度来确定成核条件。基于Gross＆＃8211; Pitaevskii方程的解析度，通过数值模拟成功地再现了实验结果。

title: Interaction and filling-induced quantum phases of dual Mott insulators of bosons and fermions
title_cn: 玻色子和费米子双Mott绝缘子的相互作用和填充诱导的量子相
abstract: Many-body effects are at the very heart of diverse phenomena found in condensed-matter physics. One striking example is the Mott-insulator phase, where conductivity is suppressed as a result of a strong repulsive interaction. Advances in cold-atom physics have led to the realization of the Mott-insulating phases of atoms in an optical lattice, mimicking the corresponding condensed-matter systems. Here, we explore an exotic strongly-correlated system of interacting dual Mott insulators of bosons and fermions. We find that an interspecies interaction between bosons and fermions drastically modifies each of the Mott insulators, causing effects that include melting, generation of composite particles, an anti-correlated phase and complete phase separation. Comparison between the experimental results and numerical simulations indicate intrinsic adiabatic heating and cooling for the attractively and repulsively interacting dual Mott insulators, respectively.
abstract_cn: 在凝聚态物理中发现的多种现象的核心是多体效应。 一个明显的例子是莫特-绝缘子相，由于强烈的排斥相互作用，导电率受到抑制。 冷原子物理学的进步已导致在光学晶格中实现原子的Mott绝缘相，从而模仿了相应的凝聚态系统。 在这里，我们探索了玻色子和费米子的双莫特绝缘子相互作用的奇异的强相关系统。 我们发现，玻色子和费米子之间的种间相互作用极大地改变了每个莫特绝缘子，引起的影响包括熔化，复合粒子的产生，反相关相和完全相分离。 实验结果与数值模拟结果的比较表明，吸引和排斥相互作用的双Mott绝缘子分别具有固有的绝热加热和冷却效果。

title: Microscopic polarization in bilayer graphene
title_cn: 双层石墨烯中的微观极化
abstract: Bilayer graphene contains, compared to single-layer graphene, additional states related to the symmetry of the layers. These states can lead to the opening of a bandgap, which is highly desirable for device applications. The gap can be either tunable through an external electric field or spontaneously formed through an interaction-induced symmetry breaking. Here, we report scanning tunnelling microscopy measurements that reveal that the microscopic nature of the bilayer gap is very different from what has been observed in previous macroscopic measurements, and from what is expected from current theoretical models. The potential difference between the layers, which is proportional to charge imbalance and determines the gap value, shows a strong dependence on the disorder potential and varies spatially in both magnitude and sign on a microscopic level. Additional interaction-induced effects are observed on applying a magnetic field, as a subgap opens once the zero-orbital Landau level is placed at the Fermi energy.
abstract_cn: 与单层石墨烯相比，双层石墨烯包含与层的对称性有关的附加状态。这些状态可能导致带隙的打开，这对于设备应用是非常需要的。间隙可以通过外部电场调节，也可以通过相互作用引起的对称破坏自发形成。在这里，我们报告扫描隧道显微镜测量结果，该结果表明双层间隙的微观性质与以前的宏观测量中所观察到的以及当前理论模型所期望的性质有很大不同。层之间的电势差与电荷不平衡成正比并确定间隙值，显示出对无序电势的强烈依赖性，并且在微观水平上的大小和符号都在空间上变化。一旦将零轨道朗道能级置于费米能上，子间隙就会打开，因此在施加磁场时还会观察到其他相互作用引起的效应。</ p>

title: Controlled near-field enhanced electron acceleration from dielectric nanospheres with intense few-cycle laser fields
title_cn: 具有强力的短周期激光场的受控近场增强了来自介电纳米球的电子加速
abstract: Collective electron motion in condensed matter typically unfolds on a sub-femtosecond timescale. The well-defined electric field evolution of intense, phase-stable few-cycle laser pulses provides an ideal tool for controlling this motion. The resulting manipulation of local electric fields at nanometre spatial and attosecond temporal scales offers unique spatio-temporal control of ultrafast nonlinear processes at the nanoscale, with important implications for the advancement of nanoelectronics. Here we demonstrate the attosecond control of the collective electron motion and directional emission from isolated dielectric (SiO2) nanoparticles with phase-stabilized few-cycle laser fields. A novel acceleration mechanism leading to the ejection of highly energetic electrons is identified by the comparison of the results to quasi-classical model calculations. The observed lightwave control in nanosized dielectrics has important implications for other material groups, including semiconductors and metals.
abstract_cn: 凝聚态电子的集体运动通常在亚飞秒级的时间尺度上展开。强烈的，相位稳定的几个周期激光脉冲的清晰定义的电场演化为控制这种运动提供了理想的工具。由此产生的对纳米空间和亚秒级时域的局部电场的操纵，为纳米级超快速非线性过程提供了独特的时空控制，这对纳米电子学的发展具有重要意义。在这里，我们证明了具有相稳定的短周期激光场的孤立电介质（SiO 2 ）纳米粒子对集体电子运动和定向发射的阿秒控制。通过将结果与准经典模型计算进行比较，可以识别出导致高能电子发射的新型加速机制。纳米电介质中观察到的光波控制对其他材料组（包括半导体和金属）具有重要意义。
